courseDescription:
This course teaches you all you need to know to get started with developing websites and mobile applications using the Ionic framework. It begins with tutorials on how to set up Ionic, as well as the developer environment needed for using the framework. It demonstrates the process of testing and debugging applications across different platforms. The first half of the course concludes with tutorials on how to add styling elements like headers, footers, buttons, and lists, using the Ionic.

The second half introduces some more styling components, as well as explaining how they can be added to a webpage, or mobile application, using Ionic. Styling components covered in this part include cards, forms, toggles, checkboxes, radio buttons, sliders, dropdowns, and tabs. The course explains the Ionic grid system, and how it is used to design responsive webpages and mobile applications.

Being a cross-platform, and web-based framework, Ionic provides web developers with a way to create highly functional web and mobile applications that leverage their existing knowledge of web development. This course suits web developers with some knowledge of web design and HTML, JavaScript and CSS. Start this course now, and be on your way to building functional, responsive, and visually pleasing applications for various platforms, using the Ionic framework, in under three hours.
